Maybe it's my body chemistry but it smells like wet grass on me. I do smell the sweet florals, I just wished the wet grass scent could disappear :/</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2096705"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2096705#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2094526" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2094526" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HippyDippy57"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="HippyDippy57" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/So-Scandal-60942.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60942.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="So Scandal!"title="So Scandal!"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2094526ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2094526" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700008">HippyDippy57</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-16">03/16/24 12:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's not a wonder that Flowerbomb endures as a popular scent.  It is an all enveloping cloud of floral gorgeousness, but not an old-fashioned floral.  A more cool and elegant take on a floral perfume.  It is so well blended that no note stands out, but they all combine to glorious effect.  I sprayed myself and clothes this morning, and 9 hrs later I can still detect it.  Once this bottle is finished, I will repurchase as I would miss it if I didn't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2094526"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2094526#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2094398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2094398" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chef Loreal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1921801"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chef Loreal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2094398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2094398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1921801">Chef Loreal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-16">03/16/24 09:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Perfume lady in the store sold me on this one. I didnt LOVE it in the store but thought it might be good for a professional<br />
Setting like my job. I bought up a huge bottle which happened to come with a ton of free stuff bc it was Black Friday. My bestie lovesssss this scent. On my it smells like the most powdery musty grandma perfume. Ended up giving it away to me bestie. My loss her gain. I kept a small travel atomizer to see how it matures of the years. I def dont get the hype but its probably just my skin chemistry.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2094398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2094398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2091427" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2091427" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="slmbrkty"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2022848"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2022848.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="slmbrkty" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pinrose/Bold-Soul-93983.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.93983.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bold Soul"title="Bold Soul"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2091427ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2091427" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2022848">slmbrkty</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-13">03/13/24 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A decent, easy to wear, non-offensive floral. I enjoy the scent, but Flowerbomb feels the same as so many other floral fragrances for a way higher price tag. I do not personally find anything profound about this scent or formula. The tea, rose, and jasmine are prominent upon first application, and then it settles into a nice spring day with a blanket of musk underneath. Longevity and sillage are moderate-high; lasts about 4 hours on my skin, a little longer on clothes, and it has a nice sillage that radiates just enough from the body. I would give it a 6.5/10, maybe a 7.5 if the price point was lower. I don't hate this, but I am not head over heels for Flowerbomb. I do not plan on purchasing a full bottle, but it's a good fragrance to keep a vial of when you're in the mood for it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2091427"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2091427#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2090642" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090642" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavieenrose1987"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1945520"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1945520.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavieenrose1987" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Libre-Le-Parfum-75676.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75676.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libre Le Parfum"title="Libre Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090642ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090642" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1945520">lavieenrose1987</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 16:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As Im still new on my fragrance journey, I asked a more knowledgeable acquaintance for recommendations. After listing off a few currently popular choices and some niche fragrances, she then giggled and said, or, if you want to be basic millennial, you can get Flowerbomb. Honestly, that right there confirmed that I needed to get my hands on at least a sample. <br />
<br />
While I get that the fragrance industry is just as bad as fast fashion when it comes to a constant stream of new releases and trends, things that are labelled basic are popular for a reason. This is a smooth blend of floral and patchouli with some spice on top which gives it a unique kick. Im not big into super girly and photorealistic florals, so this is a fantastic alternative for someone who wants something feminine with a twist. Its a fragrance that resonates better with women in my opinion, so if that matters to you, this is your girl.<br />
<br />
If this is what qualifies as basic, then call me basic. I notice that Baccarat Rouge 540 is already falling from grace into that category, so dont worry. Whatever your current it girl fragrance is, it and you will be framed as basic soon enough, then "grandma" in a couple decades from now. I look forward to the day that basic and grandma stop being used as descriptors for scents that have historic popularity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2090642"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2090642#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2090227" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090227" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="risarii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/71405"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.71405.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="risarii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Yara-76880.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76880.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yara"title="Yara"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090227ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090227" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/71405">risarii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 09:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I avoided this fragrance for a long time because of its annoying popularity, as I think a lot of people did. Now that its seemingly less ubiquitous (despite being sold at Sephora, I guess many girls have moved onto Black Opium which now seems to be the ubiquitous it girl) I decided to smell it. And I must say, it was quite good. Very good, even. Possibly great but Ill wait to say that until I smell it again. <br />
<br />
I think the tea and osmanthus keeps it from being too generic gourmand/fruitchouli (a la LVEB). Its well-composed, high quality and sort of hyper feminine (though maybe Im just being influenced by the adorable bottle). I never thought Id want to own a bottle but here I am, considering buying a bottle. <br />
<br />
Excellent throw and longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2090227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2090227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2089718" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2089718" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PhantomBelle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029931"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2029931.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PhantomBelle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Myrrhe-Mystere-83981.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83981.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrrhe Mystre"title="Myrrhe Mystre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2089718ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2089718" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029931">PhantomBelle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 19:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sampled this back in 2014 and I enjoyed it enough to buy a travel size. That little sprayer lasted me around 8 years before it was so macerated and condensed I just couldn't stand it anymore. This one is a beast-mode to me, and it lasts and projects very well. The notes are pretty much spot on, you do indeed get a lot of florals and a lot of patchouli/vanilla. I am really hoping the Tiger Lilly flanker is more calm, I want to like V&amp;R, I really do, but they are very powerful scents. <br />
<br />
Proceed with caution. <br />
<br />
Purchased way back when from Nordstrom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2089718"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2089718#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088714" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088714" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Larrynori1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1299750"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1299750.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Larrynori1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1460.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flowerbomb"title="Flowerbomb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088714ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088714" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1299750">Larrynori1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 00:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Flowerbomb is my new signature scent and I can't believe it took me this long to find it. The combination of the floral and warm base notes of vanilla and patchouli make for the perfect balance and it's both sexy and comforting. It's also not too strong or overpowering, which I like, so I can wear it to work and school without worrying that it might bother people. I am absolutely obsessed with the way I smell now and always catch myself sniffing my wrist at any chance I get. My confidence has also definitely skyrocketed because there's no better compliment to a woman that "you smell SO good"!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2088714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2088714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088596" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thaochipnd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579302.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thaochipnd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chloe/Jasminum-Sambac-57248.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57248.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasminum Sambac"title="Jasminum Sambac"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302">thaochipnd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-10">03/10/24 20:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't even see this as a floral scent, let alone a Flowerbomb like its name suggests. This was a mild disappointment.<br />
<br />
Rating: 6.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2088596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2088596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2087302" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2087302" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sweetflorallove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2020771"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2020771.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sweetflorallove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2087302ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2087302" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2020771">sweetflorallove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-09">03/09/24 12:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont get the hype with this fragrance. I tested it today at Sephora and thought it smelled kind of gross, honestly. I wish I could better describe why but I just didnt like this at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2087302"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2087302#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2086729" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2086729" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="moon-lake-nymph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1405750"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1405750.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="moon-lake-nymph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zoologist-Perfumes/Seahorse-69386.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69386.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Seahorse"title="Seahorse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2086729ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2086729" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1405750">moon-lake-nymph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-08">03/08/24 21:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, sugary, and precious. <br />
Less floral to my nose, leans MUCH more gourmand. <br />
Not a scent for a professional / corporate environment. <br />
I feel like a big pink blossom. Like a tiny, magical flower fairy. <br />
Quietly happy, youthful, serene.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2086729"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2086729#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2083648" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2083648" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nisarsarah9"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669315"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nisarsarah9" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Coach/Coach-Dreams-Sunset-66267.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66267.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coach Dreams Sunset"title="Coach Dreams Sunset"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2083648ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2083648" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669315">nisarsarah9</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-05">03/05/24 21:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A sweet, floral affair. Smells really elegant. Perfect for any occasion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2083648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2083648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2083499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2083499" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yukikiki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1527214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1527214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yukikiki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2083499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2083499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1527214">yukikiki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-05">03/05/24 17:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A sweet, floral, tea fragrance. The patchouli is present but not overwhelming. It's extremely well blended and I can't pick out where the sweetness might be coming from except maybe the vanilla orchid. Nowadays not groundbreaking but beautiful nonetheless. <br />
<br />
Have not smelled anything similar to it, and disagree with the votes in the "reminds me of" section that it's similar to LVEB. LVEB is more lipsticky and more iris based.<br />
<br />
I'm not sure if it's weak or if I go noseblind to it, but it seems to become faint rather quickly. I don't love this fragrance since I don't gravitate towards tea notes, so I don't think I'll repurchase a full bottle. But I will have a travel spray around. I've never smelled it back in the day and have no scent memories or nostalgia attached to the scent. It also doesn't smell outdated. <br />
<br />
Not work appropriate in my opinion. But great for a signature, date nights, and day to day wear. Too sweet for summer imo.<br />
<br />
Wonderfully made fragrance. Worth sampling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2083499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2083499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2082525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2082525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Treachaseff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1890111"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Treachaseff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2082525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2082525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1890111">Treachaseff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-04">03/04/24 21:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was introduced to Flowerbomb through a dupe back in 2012 (though I didn't know it was a dupe at the time). I was perusing the perfumes at a Zara in El Salvador, and Black Peony struck me. It was a little dark and fruity, warm and sensual and maybe a touch loud (although keep in mind, I was wearing it in blistering heat with no air conditioning). I kept the bottle for years and eventually it went rancid.<br />
Now I'm testing Flowerbomb, and there's just something about it that smells so...right. I didn't know it back in the early 2000s, so I don't have those "dear God, it's everywhere" associations. To me, it smells like--hear me out--lilac-colored chocolate. Not lilacs, but the color lilac and soft chocolaty nuances. I know I'm not the only person who struggles to describe a perfume that really touches them, but that's what I get. In absolutely the best way. It blends into my skin, easy on the nose. I may just be a typical 2000s girl, but I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2082525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2082525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2080851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2080851" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vowsandperfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1884041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1884041.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vowsandperfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2080851ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2080851" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1884041">vowsandperfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 08:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is lovely! I don't think it's anything really groundbreaking nowadays but it's really a safe, soft, sweet floral creamy fragance. Very feminine. I wouldn't mind having a full size of this because it's really an all occasion crowd pleaser and an easy reach - I wouldn't compare this to La Vie Est Belle because it's not nearly as overly sweet and cloying. I find it slightly more mature than LVEB. It has a moderate sillage and I find it has low to moderate lasting power - though after a while I may tire a bit of the sweetness because I don't often reach for sweet perfumes but I promise it's nothing cloying. I especially like the patchouli and sweet, flowery, warm vanilla in this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2080851"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2080851#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2076830" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Sweet and youthful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2076830"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2076830#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2074199" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2074199" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vanilllabitch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2033171"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vanilllabitch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2074199ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2074199" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2074199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2074199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073149" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073149" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="embuggle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015362"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2015362.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="embuggle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Scents-of-Wood/Plum-in-Cognac-69978.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69978.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Plum in Cognac"title="Plum in Cognac"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073149ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073149" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015362">embuggle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 19:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Am I being grandiose if I say this is symphonic? Each note is cooperating with the rest, and nothing feels out of place here. Patchouli is far from my favorite smell. In fact, I used to avoid buying any fragrance if I saw patchouli in the notes. This perfume single-handedly changed my mind. Overall, it's a general people-pleaser while still being complex and interesting and alluring. Sweet, but not too sweet. Feminine, but not juvenile. There's a reason Flowerbomb has been popular for so long.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2073149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2073149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073101" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073101" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Arcticmanatee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1981851"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1981851.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Arcticmanatee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Calvin-Klein/Obsession-248.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.248.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Obsession"title="Obsession"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073101ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073101" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1981851">Arcticmanatee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 17:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely sweet floral fruity opening. Well blended. Its hard to pick individual notes out. Really a very nice fragrance. But it did not last long enough on me. I only got about 2-3 hours. I found a travel size splash bottle at Burlington for pretty cheap so I bought it. I really like this. Ill see how its lasts as I wear it more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2073101"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2073101#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072898" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072898" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dinkleheit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701366"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1701366.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dinkleheit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Do-Son-Eau-de-Toilette-6501.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6501.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Do Son Eau de Toilette"title="Do Son Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072898ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072898" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701366">dinkleheit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 13:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a perfume that I think will serve as my go-to when I am not sure what to wear. It's perfect for intimate settings where you know you won't offend any noses because it's just one of those scents that is mass appealing. I think that is quite rare, too! Love it and is a good part of my collection now. I will just call it my black little dress of perfumes! Not the flashiest of my perfumes, but versatile and elegant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2072898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2072898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072836" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Harley522"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1673493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1673493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Harley522" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072836ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072836" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1673493">Harley522</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Old but good. This would never go out of style. Forever young, pink gentle cloud full of sugary flowers </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2072836"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2072836#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2067937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2067937" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maya lilac"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705079"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1705079.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maya lilac" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2067937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2067937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705079">Maya lilac</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 03:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Flowerbomb was a love of mine since the end of 2000s when it was released. I remember smelling it back in the days and feeling mind blown, no exaggeration At some point in my life, all I wanted to wear was Flowerbomb and La Vie est Belle. These two were my favourite perfumes for about a decade<br />
<br />
Flowerbomb is a very feminine, sensual, big bouquet of flowers, sweet vanilla based that  has a prominent patchouli note. What made this particular scent so appealing to my nose was the juxtaposition of green tea, osmanthus and patchouli. I still love it very much! It does something to me in a way that I cant explain<br />
<br />
I like that its an airy, clean, sweet floral, with fresh citruses on top but also has a strong, warm, heavy base to counterbalance the composition. Its so well done and so addictive and lasts for days on clothing. Performance on Flowerbomb was never a issue, its freaking fantastic!! Creates a nice scent bubble around me that makes me feel pretty and happy<br />
<br />
 I went through  two big bottle back in the days, and I bought a third one a few years ago. While I still love it when I wear it, I noticed that I dont reach for it so much. I feel like even though it not so unique to smell anymore because it is so popular, the scent itself is still unique! <br />
<br />
I will always have Flowerbomb in my collection, its a cult classic now. This scent is one of my first perfumes, and one of those who made me fall in love with perfume (and also with the note of patchouli).<br />
<br />
Iconic scent that aged well, unlike La Vie est Belle</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2067937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2067937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2063135" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2063135" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LANashGirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1985719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1985719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LANashGirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Hundred-Silent-Ways-37602.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37602.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hundred Silent Ways"title="Hundred Silent Ways"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2063135ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2063135" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1985719">LANashGirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-15">02/15/24 09:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I didnt like this AT ALL when it first came out. Today I love it. But I feel like a lot of my other fragrances smell like it. It must have been ahead of its time. Im excited for the new Tiger Lily! Viktor &amp; Rolf are definitely trendsetters for the mainstream perfume market.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2063135"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2063135#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2062495" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2062495" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nichoa99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846366"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1846366.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nichoa99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Liquides-Imaginaires/Blanche-Bete-70189.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70189.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche Bte"title="Blanche Bte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2062495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2062495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846366">nichoa99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-14">02/14/24 18:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this and hated it. The patchouli was too strong and it smelled like peptobismol. It reminded me of the mall and every generic perfume ever. A few months later and I can't get enough and I think it's quite unique. Weird how tastes can change like that! <br />
<br />
I also have the Dossier dupe and it's spot on and pretty long lasting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2062495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2062495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2060346" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2060346" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Blossomlove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951646"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1951646.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Blossomlove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/God-of-Fire-72381.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72381.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="God of Fire"title="God of Fire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2060346ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2060346" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951646">Blossomlove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-12">02/12/24 15:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Apparently I like floral patchouli scents because this and Coco Mademoiselle were my scents for a decade. What's not to like here? It's citrus &amp; florals with patchouli and vanilla sexiness. This scent has staying power as well! That patchouli really grounds this scent and helps it last for 6-8 hours. Lasts on clothes till you wash them. CM was my day scent and this was my night scent. I always felt sexy wearing this and this was my go to date night scent. My ex didn't really care for this one so we went to Ulta and decided on Burberry Brit for me so I ended up wearing that one for years instead but once single again, you bet I was wearing this again. That being said, Flowerbomb and Coco Mademoiselle will ALWAYS be in my collection. I bought my mom a sample kit from Sephora and she ended up picking this one out of 6 so I guess the apple doesn't fall far from the tree. I have so many other great scents so I guess i'll let her have her time with FB now. Also she's 74 s there's no age limit on this scent either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2060346"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2060346#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2054464" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
