True to its namesake, it does dry down to a "flowerbomb", which I found too sweet and possibly headache-inducing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1972007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1972007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1971913" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1971913" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nicbat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1887340"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nicbat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1971913ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1971913" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1887340">nicbat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-08">11/08/23 12:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a perfectly nice warm floral, but it is not my personal taste. A bit too floral and a bit too generic for me. I have seen a lot of people compare the new Sol de Janeiro After Hours to this fragrance, and while I see the similarities, After Hours is more my vibe - a bit more mature, complex, and sexy. However, I would only wear After Hours in the evenings, whereas I feel Flowerbomb can be worn in the day or night.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1971913"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1971913#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1969755" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1969755" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="subtlyyours"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1484865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1484865.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="subtlyyours" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mix-Bar/Vanilla-Bourbon-66235.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66235.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Bourbon"title="Vanilla Bourbon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1969755ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1969755" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1484865">subtlyyours</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-06">11/06/23 03:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance makes me so happy and i dont even know why, but its like joy should be included in the pyramid alongside patchouli, both of which Id consider quite dominant in this composition.<br />
Flowerbomb is not a floral bouquet, but its like someone used that bouquet to crack open a piata full of sweet vanilla patchouli hard candies<br />
This is a STRONG performer so less is more</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1969755"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1969755#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1967465" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1967465" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lauanevan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1040586"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1040586.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lauanevan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1967465ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1967465" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1040586">lauanevan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-03">11/03/23 03:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my first perfume love in 2008, I went to the perfume counter and gave it a nostalgic sniff. Back then I was ADDICTED to it, i was a poor teenager and always went to spray the tester. I loved the top notes, but remember it turning later less lovely. Still had to spray it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1967465"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1967465#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1967455" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1967455" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lyka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314163"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1314163.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lyka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/Devotion-Intense-96028.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96028.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Devotion Intense"title="Devotion Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1967455ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1967455" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314163">lyka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-03">11/03/23 02:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Excellent parfum fruit, fleuri, convient  tout ges, bonne tenue, bon sillage mais trop port</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1967455"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1967455#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1967273" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1967273" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cutiepi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882005"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cutiepi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1967273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1967273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882005">cutiepi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 21:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Seeing all the great reviews I decided to give this one a go. I sprayed it on a tester card and liked the scent, so I sprayed it on myself to see how it would wear. <br />
<br />
This smells terrible, there is something incredibly bitter and rank about it I just didn't like. After about 4 hours it has dried down a bit so it's not as awful, and I can smell some more floral coming through, but this one is still a no for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1967273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1967273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1965763" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1965763" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1965763ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1965763" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-01">11/01/23 05:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't mind this fragrance, but it still leaves a lot to be desired and is quite generic smelling to me. There's something that is very mass market about it, like something you'd find at a beauty counter at the mall, like at Macy's perhaps. <br />
<br />
I don't really get the tea in the opening, but I do smell the citrusy bergamot and the fruity floral osmanthus that smells like apricot. I wish I smelt more of the tea, since it would have made this perfume less cloying to my nose.<br />
<br />
I can smell hints of jasmine and orange blossom in the heart notes, but the freesia and the rose is what I smell more of. I wish I could smell more of the jasmine and orange blossom and I admittedly don't know what orchids smell like, since I have never smelt an orchid that has a fragrance. I have heard that they have vanilla-like nuances though and I can smell vanilla in this. That is in the base notes too, though.<br />
<br />
The patchouli in Flowerbomb is by far the strongest ingredient in its composition though ans it is what turns this perfume from a soft like to a "meh" for me, since I really don't like patchouli and its strange and sweet earthiness. I smell some of the musk too, but it really takes a back seat to the patchouli.<br />
<br />
As far as its scent and vibe goes, Flowerbomb is like a pink flower and patchouli scented hard candy to me. It smells edible and not completely like a "Flowerbomb." More like a "Flowerbomb" candy. It seems to be a precursor to gourmand fragrances being the most popular fragrance category a few years later and indeed up till now.<br />
<br />
I got 7 hours in total wear time from this perfume and a moderate sillage. I recommend it for spring, fall and winter and for both day and night occasions. I'd also say it's definitely a woman's perfume, despite it not being my cup of tea.<br />
<br />
Altogether, I'd give Flowerbomb by Viktor and Rolf a 5/10. It is as average as average can get for a fragrance for me. It's definitely better than La Vie Est Belle though, which this fragrance is most compared to.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1965763"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1965763#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="1460" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent2027062" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2027062" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Macleay"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312640"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312640.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Macleay" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2027062ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2027062" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312640">Macleay</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-10">01/10/24 17:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a rollerball of Flowerbomb a few weeks ago. While I dont know if Id purchase a full size, or more precisely a full price full size, Ive been having fun with my rollerball. I quite like the patchouli hard candy vibe other reviewers have pointed out. It makes me feel like a very pretty, sweet girl with a significant other who dotes on her, a close knit group of friends, and who is always organized and on top of things (but maybe thats just me projecting my wishes onto the scent). Its been beloved by so many for a reason. <br />
<br />
I do find it irritating how many reviews seem to be not only calling the scent basic but insulting its wearers. Its true Flowerbomb has mass market appeal and has been so prevalent in the fragrance world since its release that it now seems not only basic but more than a little pass to many fragheads. But mass market appeal is nothing to scoff at and this is the inevitable journey any highly popular fragrance will pass through. Glossier you, Santal 33, Baccarat rouge 540, Delina etc are starting this transition as well, and soon will be similarly scoffed at. Finally, all that making snide comments about the type of individual that wears this scent or similar others do, is make one look like someone who is into perfume for the exclusivity, rather than sincere appreciation of the art.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2027062"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2027062#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1047058" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1047058" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dahrling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/461232"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.461232.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dahrling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Scandal-45651.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45651.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scandal"title="Scandal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1047058ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1047058" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/461232">dahrling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-02">04/02/19 00:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unpopular opinion: this smells just as beautiful in the spring/summer as it does in the fall/winter - unlike LVEB this works during all seasons of the year without smelling off and both as a day and a night-time perfume (at least, on my skin when applied with a very LIGHT hand). I don't know if this has been reformulated or not, but the Flowerbomb I know is a very feminine, pretty  fragrance that makes me think of love and joy and all the good simple things in the world. If that makes it "generic" or "boring" or "vanilla" to some, then I'm sorry/not sorry to say that's all I want in my life - it may be a very "safe" fragrance but not all of us are thrill-seekers or sex kittens. I find it innocent and youthful, I don't think it's sexy - at least not Tom Ford or Mugler sexy. This is sweet and cuddly - it's like vanilla ice cream, it may not be everyone's favorite but virtually anyone can have some of it - it's universally appreciated. Vanilla is my favorite ice cream flavor, so maybe this is the perfect fragrance for girls like me. I LOVE it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="1047058"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=1047058#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent670710" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc670710" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MissAnnette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/975763"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.975763.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MissAnnette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Gentle-Fluidity-Gold-53401.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53401.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentle Fluidity Gold"title="Gentle Fluidity Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma670710ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd670710" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/975763">MissAnnette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-25">01/25/16 04:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought the whole set for my mom. She particularly likes the lotion. She said "Flowerbomb" makes her feel girly again. She is going to wear this for her Valentine's date with Dad. She is so thrilled to be wearing perfume that isn't too light, bland or boring without triggering asthma attack.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="670710"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=670710#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073149" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073149" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="embuggle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015362"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2015362.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="embuggle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Scents-of-Wood/Plum-in-Cognac-69978.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69978.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Plum in Cognac"title="Plum in Cognac"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073149ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073149" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015362">embuggle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 19:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Am I being grandiose if I say this is symphonic? Each note is cooperating with the rest, and nothing feels out of place here. Patchouli is far from my favorite smell. In fact, I used to avoid buying any fragrance if I saw patchouli in the notes. This perfume single-handedly changed my mind. Overall, it's a general people-pleaser while still being complex and interesting and alluring. Sweet, but not too sweet. Feminine, but not juvenile. There's a reason Flowerbomb has been popular for so long.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="2073149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=2073149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent653385" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc653385" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Beckylynn8881"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/241381"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.241381.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Beckylynn8881" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juicy-Couture/I-Am-Juicy-Couture-31212.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31212.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I Am Juicy Couture"title="I Am Juicy Couture"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma653385ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd653385" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/241381">Beckylynn8881</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-02">12/02/15 23:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know that many criticize this perfume and claim that it is overrated, but there is a reason why it is so popular. It's perfect for a woman who is mature enough but still in touch with her girly, feminine side and that's not a bad thing at all! It kind of got ruined when so many other perfumes tried to copy it, but you have to appreciate this perfume for being an inspiration to so many. It's a modern classic, a grown-up gourmand. And yes, the name Flowerbomb is very misleading as it smells very sugary and fruity but this is still a great scent! The base notes keep it from becoming too cavity-inducing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="653385"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=653385#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="1460" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent178785" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc178785" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aredore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11550.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aredore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Smuggler-s-Soul-26632.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26632.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Smuggler's Soul"title="Smuggler's Soul"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma178785ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd178785" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11550">Aredore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-09-04">09/04/11 10:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dear Flowerbomb,<br />
<br />
I have tried, truly tried, but I do not understand you.<br />
<br />
In spite of your listed notes, you are no floral. You are Boston fruit slices in a bottle, assorted penny candies liquified, a poor rose swimming in simple syrup.<br />
<br />
Descended you are from Angel, Lolita Lempicka, Euphoria, Coco Mademoiselle and Juicy Couture JC, yet  they manage to be interesting while you twirl your hair and drool. How is it you are so astonishingly popular? I am shocked by it. I wonder if today's girls simply find no discernible difference between flies and men. <br />
<br />
Poor Flowerbomb, a classic of perfumery you are not. You are to Coco Mademoiselle as Giorgio was to Poison. As your simple charms lose their appeal, your formula will cheapened, reduced to a 40 dollar EDT in Wallgreens for our daughters to buy discounted for their "naughties" theme parties, where the teenage girls of 2030 will dress like hipsters, dance to "Sexyback" and say "I can't believe Mom used to wear this!"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="178785"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=178785#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent635268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc635268" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cocotea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884291"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.884291.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cocotea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma635268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd635268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884291">Cocotea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-10-02">10/02/15 07:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I may get my head chewed off for my take on this fragrance but I don't care. I think as a so called classic people are expected to love it or else you run the risk of not being sophisticated, classy or not a serious perfume lover. I received a .25 oz bottle as a gift and generously applied to my neck and arms fully expecting to be transformed by the amazingness that I expected "the" Flowerbomb to be. Unimpressed was I to say the least. Seriously? That's it? I smell patchouli and tea and some warm sweet note. Could be amber or caramel or vanilla. Smells like Bath and Bodyworks' Sensual Amber with patchouli thrown in. There is a note in there which gives me a headache thereby rendering it unwearable. Yes it  smells good, maybe even expensive and it is. But this is much ado about nothing to me. I gave it away.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="635268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=635268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent689539" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc689539" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aco89"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/986543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aco89" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma689539ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd689539" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/986543">Aco89</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-22">03/22/16 20:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I need someone to explain the appeal of this perfume to me. My complete and utter disdain for this fragrance just goes to show how individual scent is. To me, this isn't a floral at all, but rather spun sugar and syrup in a bottle. It is so sweet and so strong that it actually makes me feel a bit sick when I smell it. It's also much warmer than I like.<br />
<br />
I think this would really suit someone that enjoys very warm, tooth-achingly sweet, strong scents. I prefer something fresher and much, much less sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="689539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=689539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent483077" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc483077" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lybarra118"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/781416"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.781416.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lybarra118" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Jacobs/Daisy-Ever-So-Fresh-75191.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75191.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daisy Ever So Fresh"title="Daisy Ever So Fresh"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma483077ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd483077" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/781416">Lybarra118</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-07">05/07/14 10:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Some might hate me for this, but I don't like Flowerbomb. I'm sorry, I know a lot of people love it and I can appreciate that, but I can't stand it. Something about it bothers me and it's not just the fact that I smell it everywhere. I don't like it on myself and I can't stand it on my co-workers. It gives me a headache.<br />
<br />
It's just a dreadful concoction of ingredients, in my opinion; flowers (orchid), patchouli, musk, freesia, and there's even an underlying powdery scent. Not to mention the sweetness. It just doesn't work for me. There are fragrances that smell good on others yet they don't necessarily work on me, but when I smell Flowerbomb on anyone near me, I cringe.<br />
<br />
I've tried to like it, I've tried to force myself. I even still test it at Sephora in hopes something in my nose has changed, but nothing works.<br />
<br />
I don't know, I seem to dislike most popular or "best-selling" perfumes.<br />
<br />
But I will say, Viktor and Rolf have done an excellent marketing job.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="483077"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=483077#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent318498" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc318498" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="annettepe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/219457"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.219457.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="annettepe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Irish-Leather-18393.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18393.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Irish Leather"title="Irish Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma318498ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd318498" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/219457">annettepe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-12-27">12/27/12 10:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i just bought my first Flowerbomb EDP and i love it! to me it does not smell at all like the notes that are listed, nor do i find this extremely florally like the name of the perfume suggests.<br />
<br />
i think this smells gourmand like and very delicious! its very sweet and creamy if thats not weird to say, with strong warm vanilla and faint floral notes. its also a little powdery but in a very comforting way. to me the patchouli is not strong at all even though this got the most votes on the perfume pyramid. just the perfect amount that gives it dimension and depth. its very feminine and i find it quiet sexy and alluring. i think this perfume is suitable for both daily use with a light hand and for the night.<br />
<br />
i kind of got the idea that this fragrance was very screaming and in your face but i personally find it quiet soft but still very distinctive. its such a beautiful scent! it lasts long on my skin which is always a good thing. also i love the bottle, it looks so sophisticated and classy. <br />
<br />
i understand the similarity between this and la vie est belle by Lancome but i find that flowerbomb is a more mature and sophisticated version as i find the la vie est belle more fruity and i somehow tend to associate fruity notes with a younger crowd.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1460"comment_id="318498"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Viktor-Rolf/Flowerbomb-1460.html?ccid=318498#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="1460" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgH0e5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');

</script>
